intro: Minuartia wilczekii, commonly known as the Wilczek's sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its leaves are usually linear and closely arranged, aiding in water retention. Minuartia wilczekii plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas.
